title: Home
text:
I am Wong Zi Xin, a Year 3 undergraduate student double majoring in Psychology and Communications and New Media at the National University of Singapore. I am particularly interested in children’s moral development, and am currently a part of the NUS Child Development Lab where we look at moral behaviour in children. I aspire to work in a field directly related to children in the future!








To share a little more about myself, I love cafe hopping with my friends and dancing in my free time when I am not caught up with school work and commitments. Some of the cafes on my list to explore include September Coffee and Nesuto. I also love travelling, and some countries on my bucket list are Nepal, Italy and Vietnam. I recently visited Kyoto and Osaka over the summer break, and miss the delicious food there!



I created this website as part of my project for my NM2207 module, and am excited to share my creations with what I have learnt in class! I will soon be starting on my data story project, stay tuned for the end product!

title: NM2207 Weekly Codes
text:
Click on any one of the folders below to see what I have been doing and have learnt in each week of class! Each folder contains the data sets I have used, the Code Along practices and Challenge submissions for each week. From Week 9 onward, diary entries logging the progress for my Final Project will be in the folders. Hi there

title: Data Story
text:
First, I was interested in finding out about the yearly number of passengers travelling by air in the European Union region. I was particularly interested in looking at how much the numbers have dwindled since the outbreak of the pandemic, and how much air travel picked up in a post COVID world.





From this line graph, it is evident that there is a steady increase in the number of air travel passengers since 2011, up till the outbreak of COVID-19 in 2019. From 2019-2020, the number of passengers decreased sharply. Following the opening up of borders again from 2020 onwards, there was a gradual increase in the number of passengers again in 2021, and a sharper increase from 2021-2022.
